{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3522576,"name":"","username":"manso","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/m/e99b99/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T19:38:58.704Z","cooked":"

Last season at the Hudson Valley Regional, I saw fewer than five tank drives, including ours. But this year, it looks like defense will be less important, which would be advantageous to teams that still rely on tank drive. And I think mecanum drive might make a small comeback this year, as a cheaper alternative to swerve.

  • West Coast Drive
  • Swerve Drive
  • Tank Drive
  • Mecanum
  • Other
0 voters

manso:

And I think mecanum drive might make a small comeback this year, as a cheaper alternative to swerve.

I would doubt this. Anyone who already invested into swerve will just use that, and I think of all teams I know who ran tank last year, almost all now either have possession of or are currently running swerve for 2025. I think spending funds on mecanum still would not be worth it, I’d just shift those funds to swerve for 2026 and beyond if applicable to the game.

apperently @Holtzman agrees…

manso:

I think mecanum drive might make a small comeback this year, as a cheaper alternative to swerve.

I can maybe see it more as teams who have it might use it over swerve because we don’t need to pump out full field cycles. Plus, it might be better because it goes somewhat slower, feels smoother, and many teams probably used mecanum in previous games (or it will just prove better for newer teams compared to tank).

So unlike last year, I don’t think my team’s turbo button will do too much due to the field size and the potential for tipping. But, who knows.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-11T18:23:51.138Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":258,"readers_count":257,"score":61.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491061,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-drivetrain-this-year-poll","display_username":"Josh","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":70335,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"FTC 6603 Project Manager | Former Disruptive Innovator FRC 6317"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-drivetrain-this-year-poll/491061/4","custom_user_title":"FTC 6603 Project Manager | Former Disruptive Innovator FRC 6317","reactions":[{"id":"-1","type":"emoji","count":3},{"id":"thinking","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3522663,"name":null,"username":"2930notjorde","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/2930notjorde/{size}/246278_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T20:53:37.058Z","cooked":"

This of all polls I feel will be HEAVILY suspectible to CD bias, so approach its results with excessive caution.

That said, I do expect swerve to continue to grow in popularity as it gets more accessible with the new TTB modules being a solid option for lower resource teams.

AegisNova:

Plus, it might be better because it goes somewhat slower

While the strafing may be a benefit to teams with debatable aim, I think that’s hustling backwards in the modern age.

And I’m saying that as someone who will happily run an AM14U6 this year. We lost our programmer expertise to graduation, we started late this year, and I’m not tilting at that windmill during build season with the team we have. Probably for the off-season.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-10T21:09:24.331Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":68.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491061,"topic_slug":"what-is-your-drivetrain-this-year-poll","display_username":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":true,"admin":false,"staff":true,"user_id":3095,"hidden":false,"trust_level":4,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"says you should come to SCRIW in October"},"post_url":"/t/what-is-your-drivetrain-this-year-poll/491061/6","custom_user_title":"says you should come to SCRIW in October","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3522694,"name":"Cooper Surma","username":"CooperSurma","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/coopersurma/{size}/232004_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-10T21:22:41.971Z","cooked":"

I think if this game was released in the pre-swerve era of FRC we would see a lot of competitive mecanum bots (I would say this game is better mecanum than both 2017 and 2019, which both had top tier bots in 1986 and 118* respectively). However, with the availability and accessibility of swerve today I see no reason for a team to run anything other than an AM14U or swerve.

*: I know 118 2019 was actually h-drive but most of the same benefits/drawbacks apply

Mecanum is much easier to defend at a loading station than tank or swerve because it’s easier to push sideways.

I would not suggest that any newer team use mecanum if they have not done so before, a well driven tank drive will always beat a poorly programed and driven mecanum drive. A new season is not the time to try out a new drivetrain.

Speed is defined by gearing, not drivetrain type. Smoothness is defined by programming and driver practice.

I’ve always liked the non-swerve omnidirectional drivetrains, particularly the “drop drives” like octocanum and nonadrive, but there’s a lot less reason to use them nowadays. Swerve has a massive advantage in mobility, tank is much easier to build and program, leaving more room for driver practice.
